RT @RepCasten Wishing my good friend, mentor, and fellow science nerd, @RepBillFoster a very happy birthday!! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FBGoDtrUcA0zi_5.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FBGoDtqVIAYupYi.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FBGoDtsUYBMjns-.jpg
TL;DR - @POTUS Biden is making good on his promise to take the climate crisis seriously. It’s time for Congress to take climate action with the #BuildBackBetter Act.

Finally, the Build Back Better Act includes investments in natural solutions, boosting the ability of America’s farms, forests, and ranches to remove carbon pollution from the air.

Those will help keep an extra 44 million tons of CO2 emissions out of our atmosphere.

🚗There are also huge investments in EVs and charging stations in the BBB Act.

We need those to meet @POTUS's goal of ensuring at least half the cars sold in America by 2030 are electric - a goal supported by automakers like GM and Ford!
https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/biden-set-target-50-evs-by-2030-industry-backs-goal-2021-08-05/

The bill also includes a methane fee that can reduce pollution from the oil & gas industry.

This is crucial: According to IPCC 'Code Red' report, cutting methane pollution is a necessary and relatively quick way to start moderating global temperatures.
https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/09/opinion/climate-crisis-carbon-dioxide.html

☝ Just those three investments would help reduce U.S. emissions by up to 715 million tons by 2030 - while also ensuring cleaner air and lowering energy costs for families.

But wait! There’s more (including an important fee to address a dangerous super pollutant) 👇

The #BuildBackBetter Act would help clean up the power sector through:

💡 Strong tax credits for clean power like wind and solar
💡 A Clean Electricity Performance Program with grants for utilities that embrace clean energy
💡 Funds to help rural cooperatives decarbonize

How does the Build Back Better Act get us there?

Mainly through long-lasting investments to help decarbonize the electricity sector, which is the 2nd largest source of emissions in America (and a vital target in our Climate Crisis Action Plan).
https://climatecrisis.house.gov/report

In fact, the BBB Act includes “more reductions than any other single action that any part of the federal government has ever taken to tackle climate change,” according to @rhodium_group. (And all without raising taxes on folks making less than $400k/yr!)
https://rhg.com/research/build-back-better-congress-budget/

The #BuildBackBetter Act can help us reduce at least ✨830+ MILLION TONS✨ of CO2 emissions by 2030.
That's... A LOT.
It's the equivalent of zeroing out annual emissions from TX and FL combined - or getting all cars and light-duty vehicles off the road. 👇
https://rhg.com/research/build-back-better-congress-budget/

We know passing the #BuildBackBetter Act will create jobs, cut taxes for working families, and lower the costs of prescription drugs and child care across America.

At this point in our investigation, we can say that, without a doubt, Donald Trump’s efforts to spread his "Big Lie" and undermine the results of the election helped incite almost 1,000 Americans to breach the Capitol in a violent insurrection on January 6, 2021.

More will come to light. We're still waiting on additional Trump White House records from the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA), dating back to November 3, 2020. And we will conduct additional witness interviews as appropriate. /13

FINDING 6: By pursuing false claims of election fraud before votes were certified, DOJ deviated from longstanding practice meant to avoid inserting DOJ itself as an issue in the election. DOJ took overt steps to investigate false claims of election fraud before certification. /12

FINDING 5: Trump forced the resignation of U.S. Attorney Byung Jin (“BJay”) Pak, whom he believed was not doing enough to address false claims of election fraud in Georgia. Trump then went outside the line of succession when naming an Acting U.S. Attorney. /11

FINDING 4: Trump allies with links to the “Stop the Steal” movement and the January 6 insurrection participated in the pressure campaign against DOJ, including U.S. Representative Scott Perry (R-PA), PA State Sen. Doug Mastriano, and Trump campaign advisor Cleta Mitchell. /10

FINDING 3: After personally meeting with Trump, Jeffrey Bossert Clark pushed Rosen and Donoghue to assist Trump’s election subversion scheme—and told Rosen he would decline Trump’s potential offer to install him as Acting Attorney General if Rosen agreed to aid that scheme. /9

FINDING 2: White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows asked Acting Attorney General Rosen to initiate election fraud investigations on multiple occasions, violating longstanding restrictions on White House-DOJ communications about specific law enforcement matters. /8

FINDING 1: President Trump repeatedly asked DOJ leadership to endorse his false claims that the election was stolen & assist his efforts to overturn the election results, beginning on the day AG Barr announced his resignation and cumulating to the January 6 insurrection. /7

The Committee requested to interview Jeffrey Clark, whom DOJ authorized to testify in July. Clark still has not agreed to the Committee’s request that he sit for a voluntary interview. Today, Chair @SenatorDurbin asked the D.C. Bar to conduct a review of Clark's conduct. /5

The Committee interviewed key former DOJ personnel, including Rosen, former Principal Associate Deputy AG Richard Donoghue, and former U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of Georgia Byung Jin (“BJay”) Pak.

Transcripts of those interviews here: /4 https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/subverting-justice-how-the-former-president-and-his-allies-pressured-doj-to-overturn-the-2020-election

The Senate Judiciary Committee immediately launched an investigation into these reports. On January 23, we asked DOJ to produce documents related to these efforts, which led to the receipt of several hundred pages of calendars, emails, & other documents in the ensuing months. /3
